intro: Scorzonera cenopleura, commonly known as the alpine scorzonera, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its hairy, upright stems and basal leaves that are often lobed or divided. The plant produces yellow flowers with ray florets, typically blooming in late summer. Scorzonera cenopleura is adapted to cold, rocky environments and is often found in alpine meadows and slopes. Its root system is fibrous and may have medicinal properties in traditional herbal practices.
